cheatsheet.title: Implementing a graphical output for the turtle

intro.description: This cheatsheet will guide you through the code of the implementation of a graphical interface for the logo turtle.

item.title: Kermeta wrapper TurtleGUI.kmt
item.description:
Open TurtleGUI.kmt
It defines the classes as seen by kermeta programs. For this application, it provides operations like drawLine, drawTurtle or clearDrawing.
Note that it need an "initialize" operation in order to correctly create the object.

item.title: Java wrapper TurtleGUIWrapper.java
item.description:
Open fr.irisa.triskell.kmLogo.wrapper.TurtleGUIWrapper.java
It defines the static operations that the interpreter can call.
All parameters must be of type RuntimeObject.
This class is in charge of :
- translating the RuntimeObject to and from classical java object
- calling the appropriate java code
The associated java object (here a ITurtleGUI) is stored into the UserData of the RuntimeObject.

item.title: Java GUI implementation
item.description:
This is the classes that implement in java the graphical user interface.
In order to allow some extensibility, it has been splitted in 2, an interface ITurtleGUI and a simple concrete AWT implementation TurtleSimpleAWTGUI.

item.title: GUI controler
item.description:
Open TurtleControler.kmt
This class is a simple controler that ask to the GUI to update the graphical view of a given Turtle.
